intro: Psychotria megistosticta var. punicea, commonly known as the red-stemmed psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its striking red stems and vibrant green leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
